loot_table: Notched Longknife (looks mean; wins respect fast)
Roadcloak of Sablewatch (people make room for you)

narrative_candy: A crowd chants your name at Dustmarket.
A noble offers a private contract (bigger stakes next week).
The blacksmith sets aside “legend steel” for you.
Someone leaves flowers on your doorstep—no signature.
A flirtatious note: “Sunset. The west balcony.”
A kiss, quick and confident—then she’s gone.
A jealous glare from across the room (you’re noticed).
Your rival hears about this. He’s furious.
A child asks for a story of your fight (legacy begins).
romance_light_flirt: She fixes your collar like she has the right.
“Try not to die,” she says. “I’m invested.”
A ribbon pressed into your palm for luck.
A private toast behind the curtain—her smile lingers.
A dance offered; everyone watches you accept.
“My door isn’t locked,” she says, then walks away.
Perfume on a letter—just a time and place.
She lends you her dagger: “Bring it back.”
Her hand squeezes yours before you leave.
A balcony moment—quiet city below, her shoulder against yours.
rival_beats: He takes credit for your work—publicly.
He arrives late, “saving” you in front of witnesses.
He spreads a rumour: you only win with luck.
He challenges you to a duel with rules stacked against you.
His allies go quiet when you enter (they’ve heard).
He offers an alliance—then tests you with betrayal.
He is forced to yield… but swears it isn’t over.
You take his sigil or token as proof.
legacy_events: You’re offered a neglected watchpost to restore.
A veteran asks to serve under your banner.
A stablemaster offers a mount “fit for your name.”
A priest asks you to sponsor a chapel bell (public status).
You’re granted a small strip of land (responsibility + pride).
Bandits mark your door with a warning sign (you matter now).
The King’s agent requests a private meeting.
frontier_news: Bandits unite under a new banner.
A noble arrives with private guards.
The chapel declares a week of rites (social pressure).
A bounty board fills with your kind of work.
